name: NONONO
address: 118 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA

reviews.text: Casual yakitori spot - great value! Love the DIY hand roll and karaage too. Would definitely recommend an extra serving of the tsukune (chicken meatball skewer). So flavourful!
Delicious yakitori in a lovely space

Looking for a cozy place for lunch with the kids, I stumbled upon this place. The menu was very varied and provided plenty of options for us. We thoroughly enjoyed the food, and everything was excellent. Maybe just dessrt not to many options.

Our favorite was their kalbi, which was so juicy and melted in your mouth. And Tsukune was great too!

The service was also excellent. Kudos to the staff who served our table. I will definitely be back!

The food at NONONO is so fun! We were staying nearby and found this place via Google Maps. The chicken meatball was AWESOME, we also enjoyed the corn and two sushi rolls. We were able to sneak in a late-night reservation, and the staff was very accommodating. Can't wait to go back!
Fun place, easy. Unique dishes, fairly light but flavorful.
Nice ambience and cozy environment. Limited chicken thigh yakitori is really good. Mentaiko cream spaghetti, eggplant, and seaweed salad is on the heavier side.
Skewers are great!

Nonono is a fantastic spot â€” stylish, lively, and with great presentation from the menu to the dishes themselves. We ordered the thigh yakitori, mixed tartare, kalbi don, and sukiyaki udon, and everything was delicious, flavorful, and tender.

Itâ€™s clearly a popular place, and for good reason â€” the food and atmosphere both impress without feeling pretentious. 10/10 would definitely come back.

We ate fried rice, deep fried shrimp, ramen soup
soup all was very good, service
Good date spot, really like the Chinese eggplant. A bit of a wait and somewhat pricy for size of dishes.
I was very happy with my shrimp katsu lunch set, but we found the portion for the ramen a bit small for the price. Weâ€™ll be back to give their sushi options a try.

The food was excellent.
The seating arrangeme t is a little interesting.
That restaurant is as close to a Japanese one into Kyoto as I have found so far.
I will be back

The food and atmosphere were good. I forgot to take a picture of the skewers. The wings were way too salty, but the chicken breast was really yummy. Overall, their portions are pretty small. They have a happy hour until 6 PM
Simply delicious Japanese food. So flavorful and excellent portions. Personally this meal reminded me of similar meals I've had in Tokyo so big points for authenticity.

Tender and tasty short ribs are so delectable.  The chicken is very flavorful.  Just about anything skewered is awesome and prepared to perfection.  The costs will add up as youâ€™ll likely want more and more.   I have been here many times and is a favorite for me and family.

highball drink is a basic to see and not all japanese places have this drink in ny using good whiskey is key  menu is good and price too  yakitory is enough options for me  cute place good service overall

Menu change is a tragedy. I had been coming here for years and really wonâ€™t be coming much anymore. All the menu variety is gone, and the portions are half of what they used to be - tartare literally used to be double the size. Drinks have zero (zero) liquor. Used to feel special now feels corporatized for efficiency (smaller menu - smaller portions). Buttered clams also not on the menu anymore. A real disappointment for the residents of Nomad and Murray hill and for former fans.
The yakitori and the crab fried rice are good. Fast service.
Great yakitori
Menu changed in the last year, perhaps a few times, and all my favorite dishes are gone
Extremely disappointed with the new menu - all dishes have terrible seasoning and tasted salty as hell. Does the chef even have any palate? I really miss the creamy Udon and diverse yakitori.

They have downgraded their menu. Used to have a lot of authentic and interesting dish. Half of their menu is changed now. They now selling sushi that are the same as what cheap convenient stores are selling. A lot of their dishes are pretty salty too, have to drink lots of water. Seems like they either changed management or chef. Would not come again. This place used to be a YES YES YES , now itâ€™s a NO NO NO.

Great place to eat fish, personally the salmon and the tartare are the best of the menu. The tuna has an amazing look, but it wasnâ€™t so fresh. Overall a great experience and great price for the value.
Great food, drinks and space.

Came in for an early dinner and we were blown away by the food!! All comes out so fast and everything from the skewers to the ceviche (def the standout for us) to the corn was all delicious. The ice cream was soooo good too ! Highly recommend
Ramen is delicious, the asparagus was crispy and savory with the peanut based sauce, and the karaage was well seasoned and crunchy. Great place for a good dinner.

This izakaya spot in Midtown offers a variety of Japanese dishes, from noodle dishes to sushi to skewers. They have two levels here, so there's plenty of seating, but try to grab a reservation before going if you can! Service here is pretty good.

I got a couple of their cocktails, skewers, sashimi set, karaage, and ramen. Everything was delicious. The sashimi was so fresh and the cuts were very thick. The skewers were packed full of flavor and good portions. The karaage was also good portions and both crispy but juicy. And, the ramen was rich and had generous cuts of meat (you can also choose between chicken and pork!). Overall, a good izakaya spot and I would definitely come back.

+ Get $25 off using the link on my profile!

Tried coming here for lunch a while back and dinner recently. Itâ€™s an excellent spot and gets filled up pretty quickly at night. The rolls and yakitori are great but the salmon tataki takes the spotlight with its unique flavors in shoyu avocado. We enjoyed getting a few small plates from each section rather than two mains, as we got to try multiple dishes over a well paced meal.

The premium malt beer is creamy and amazing; the ume cocktail is quite sweet so Iâ€™d personally stay away from that. Thereâ€™s a mini happy hour Sun-Thurs 5-6pm thatâ€™s nice to catch.
Please bring back the old menuğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ Please bring back the cream udonğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ«¶ğŸ‘¼
Todo buenÃ­simo.

ì•¼í‚¤í† ë¦¬ì™€ ë¼ë©˜, ë¡¤, ë®ë°¥ ë“±ì„ íŒŒëŠ” íŠ¸ëœë””í•œ ê°ì„±ì˜ ì¼ë³¸ì‹ ë ˆìŠ¤í† ë‘ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë‚´ë¶€ ì¸í…Œë¦¬ì–´ì™€ ë””ìì¸ì´ í›Œë¥­í•´ì„œ ìŒì‹ì˜ ë§›ì„ ë”í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì¶”ì²œë©”ë‰´ëŠ” íƒ„íƒ„ë©˜ê³¼ Kalbi-Don ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì •ë§ ë§›ìˆì—ˆê³  ì„œë¹„ìŠ¤ë„ í›Œë¥­í–ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì˜ˆì•½ì„ ë¯¸ë¦¬ í•˜ê³  ê°€ì‹œê¸°ë¥¼ ì¶”ì²œë“œë¦½ë‹ˆë‹¤.
They changed the menu few weeks ago. Some classic dishes and most of the skewers are gone. Not a big fan of that as an old customer.

The menu changed in the last month or so and the food options are not as good as they were (in the past would give this place a 4, but now it's a 3).  Don't get the tuna roll unless you want a tuna fish sandwich (would not recommend that one ever again).

All the dishes we ordered were delicious.
Fish tartareâ­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
The combination of fresh diced fish, and the burst of flavor from the salmon roe was perfect. I loved the crispy cracker on the side, which added a nice crunch and balanced the textures beautifully. Each bite felt light yet rich in flavor. Definitely one of the highlights of the meal, and I would come back just to order this again!

Cream udonâ­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
The mentaiko cream udon was amazing! The sauce was rich, creamy, and perfectly balanced with the salty kick of the mentaiko. The udon noodles were chewy and soaked up the flavor really well, and the mushrooms added a nice earthy touch. It was comforting, flavorful, and definitely a must-try dish.

Tantan noodles â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
The tantanmen was also absolutely delicious! The broth had a perfect balance of creaminess, spice, and nutty sesame flavor. The noodles were cooked just right, with a nice chewy texture that held the sauce well. Topped with flavorful minced pork and fresh greens, every bite was rich and satisfying. Definitely one of the best bowls of tantanmen Iâ€™ve had!

One thing that could have been better was the communication about closing time. We were not informed about the restaurantâ€™s closing time before ordering, and only while our food was being served did the server mention that they were about to close. Because of that, we had to rush through our meal instead of enjoying it at a relaxed pace. Of course, it was also partly our fault for not checking the closing time before visiting, but it would have been much more considerate if the staff had asked us while we were waiting for a table whether we were okay with the late hour.

TLDR: huge change in menu. Used to be one of my go-to places in the city for yakitori. Also, given that yakitori was what this place was known for mainly, itâ€™s a pity to see that theyâ€™ve gotten rid of most of it. Now thereâ€™s not much that is special about nonono, not sure if we will come back :(

Love it here! Have been here a few times with friends and family and you canâ€™t go wrong if you love Japanese food and seafood!! The Nonono mix tartare is a must, great citrus and salty flavors with such fresh fish. Any of the sushi and skewers are also solid choices. The karaage is also exactly what you expect, crispy, juicy, and tangy with the lemon. We really enjoyed the miso tonton ramen as well and the unagi don. Just a great solid place. Servers are super kind and attentive, thereâ€™s a lot seating and can be fun for friends or family! Highly recommend!

Came with some friends and we loved it! Cute place as well! Super fresh and tasty, good portions for price. We shared the mixed tartare and loved the sauce it was in. I had the Zuke Maguro with a side of rice, great quality, smooth texture. The service was attentive, waiters constantly filling water (they mustâ€™ve seen the other reviews commenting on this in the past). Only problem was that the udon and ramen for my friends came nearly 10 minutes before my sashimi which I had to ask about.
Food was good, not good enough to serve small portions and charge us what they did. Drink I finished very quickly and felt like there was no gin in it. My bf and I left hungry after spending $100
Best bang for your buck in midtown south. We ordered 4 dishes and the bill was under $75. The kalbi don was our favorite. Least favorite was dessert (too lite). But overall a great place.

We went around 1 p.m. on Saturday. There was no wait, and we were seated at a bar table.
This was my third visit to this restaurant, and as always, the staff was friendly and professional.

We ordered four appetizers and one main dish. The portion size for the main dish was just as generous as it was before COVIDâ€”hard to believe for NYC!

All of the appetizers shown in my attached pictures are recommended, except for the one in the fourth picture (yellowtail). That dish consists of yellowtail cubes, slices of beet, and nuts. It needs more sauce to better blend the flavors of the beet and fish, and the nuts should be replaced, as they donâ€™t complement the dish well.
Sooooo yummy and reasonably priced. Will go again

Theyâ€™ve significantly changed their menu so much that the variety of yakitori chicken skewers are gone. This place has lost its purpose and itâ€™s just your average Japanese food place. Not worth $50+ pp.

5 outta 5 but really 10 over 10. O visited Japan a few years back and being in this space served this delicious thoughtfully prepared and presented food just gave Mr warm nostalgic memories! Wow. I mean the place was noisy and very bustling ( this was right smack in the middle of the week mind you) and you needed to exercise just a little bit of patience to be approached by one of the lovely and attentive servers but that takes nothing away from the experience. Nonono owes me nothing and I will be back for sure. I found a new spot in the city that takes me back to Japan. The yakitori is roasted right in front of you and you can just get whiff of the aroma and subtle smokiness of the meats are they are being cooked to perfection. This is the high level of service that the Japanese embody and I'm glad to find yet another slice of that in the city without having to sit in a stuffy Michelin rated restaurant to experience it. Thank you nonono!
Always can find a table here and the yakatori is great. Good service good prices and great food. I go here regularly

Definitely in a top three sushi places I have eaten in my life. Every dish has a unique texture, flavor, and sauce. Everything is extremely delicious, fresh, and looks amazing. A definite must when you visit NYC and make resos. Will absolutely return.
Amazing food & the hostess was so lovely.

Great variety in food, but quality disappointed. Either they were rushed or busy that day, but chicken skewers seems dried out a bit. Eggplant was good but could be better. Same for Sushi which tasted good but wasn't too fresh. Will probably give it another chance and see.

Dinner was incredible. The flavors, selections, quality all excellent. Our favs were the tartare with chips, shishito peppers, & choc cake! Beautiful visual menu that has vegetarian options front and center. Came for impromptu date night & we were seated at the bar right away. Staff very nice and our food came out fast. Perfect vibes for date night, and there seemed to be the after work crowd too.
Every dish was greatğŸ‘

Very authentic yakitori!
Loved every dish we ordered.
My favorite was the eggplant with miso.

We were seated in the first floor since we had a stroller (they had a baby chair).

The second floor was so romantic!
Staff were all very kind.

This cozy izakaya gives off total hipster and chill vibes, a delightful find in the FlatIron district of Manhattan. Reserve ahead, I came here with 2 friends on a Sunday evening at 6:30pm and they seated us at a super narrow corner table on the 2nd story facing the wall. Level 2 is pretty dimly lit and felt cramped as we were only inches from other patrons. The menu here is primarily Japanese but we also found a few items that were an interesting Italian-Japanese fusion.

We ordered the following to share:

1)chicken thighs yakitori - juicy and tender
2) chicken breast yakitori - juicy
2)angus prime galbi yakitori - chewy
3)pork with shio yakitori - tender but sweet
4) Nasu Dengaku (Eggplant) - soft; flavorful
5) Yaki Corn - overkill with parm
6) Lobster in miso butter - smooth a fave
7) Cod Roe cream udon - heavy/miss
8) Salmon Donburi - small portions but ğŸ‘Œ
9) Ebi Katsu - scrumptious and crispy
10) Branzino in Lemon Mayo - zesty a fave
11) Kuro Goma - very smol but perfect texture

The food here is pretty up to par for our standards. Service is decent but not attentive. Bathrooms are clean, overall ambiance is relaxed. Great for date nights.

There's good food everywhere in NYC, but then there are places where everything on the menu just HITs. Reasonably priced and so much of variety, this place has food that just tastes so dang good. Everything comes out looking amazing and tasting even better. The seating is roomy and comfortable without being overly bougie, the staff are quick and attentive but not overbearing.

My top picks:
All the grilled skewers - pork belly is the best imo, but the chicken a close second - came out crispy and golden and still piping hot. Not a bad idea to just get one of each and try them all.

Sushi/sashimi - even a standard spicy tuna roll was great; not too much rice, a good amount of fish. The mix tartare was such a good blend of super crispy chips, fresh fish and a light blend of avocado, roe, and ponzu sauce.

Absolute favorite:
The cod cream Udon. If you come for comfort food and get nothing else, get this. If warm, soft, and cuddly weren't weird words used to describe food I'd use them. The sauce is so creamy yet so light, and the Udon noodles are just enough to feel chewy and thick while still feeling like they melt in your mouth. The smattering of seafood mushrooms is the perfect accompaniment, adding a bit of earthiness and texture along w the garnish on top. I have yet to try out everything on the menu here but I still get the cod cream udon every time.

Everything we ordered was fantastic! They have a huge variety of authentic Japanese dishes, and the quality far exceeded our expectations, especially at those prices.
The sushi was amazing, Crunchy Tuna Tartar roll with tempura flakes was my personal favorite. Also, the salmon hand roll was great, it was really fun to assemble ourselves. Also, we loved Yakitori Angus Prime which was very flavorful and juicy.
We had a reservation for a Thursday night, the place was full, so definitely a popular spot. Iâ€™d love to come back and try more from the menu!

The Izakaya style food here is yummy with a decent decor.  I particularly love the tender buttery Wagu beef, juicy crispy shrimp katsu and their perfectly grilled chicken skewer (generous delicious sauce over the rice). Their beautiful cocktails were perfectly made too. You could also choose from a good variety of their lunch specials with a decent price too.

Great atmosphere, beautiful dishes and lovely design.  There are homages to Japanese culture throughout with the design.
It is small shareable plates and works well for a group setting.  We had a group of 6 and it was perfect.
Service was excellent, everything tasted so fresh and delicious, definitely will be returning.

A friend visiting the city picked it for dinner. The location was convenient. The restaurant is nice and the staff was very helpful.

The quality / price is not great. The food setting is amazing and it looks just like the pictures from the menu. The food tasted good but not great. I was expecting it to be better based on the price. I would not recommend it. The best were the rolls and a mushroom platter we ordered. The rest disappointed a little.

To be fair I will say the place had a crowd and it might be that it might just be us.

The food was mid. Pricing is reasonable for the location, but there are so many better options at this price point that it's hard to justify coming here.

We started with the seafood tartare, followed by skewers of anchovy octopus, beef tongue, lobster miso butter, chicken heart, chicken tail, and chicken oysters. We finished with the Suishingen mochi.

NONONO offers interesting and flavorful saucesâ€”from the tartare to the anchovy sauce used on the octopusâ€”but unfortunately, they weren't enough to make up for the disappointing grilled items. The chicken was bland, and some pieces were overcooked and burnt. The beef tongue was served lukewarm, which didn't help its texture or flavor.

Overall, it's not worth it.

The best vegetarian udon in town (for me)!!!!!! As you can see I finished the whole thing. I recommend letting the plums break and soak in the soup so you get a nice kick of sour in combination with the broth umami.

I recommend the sesame dessert!

Their service is less than pleasant but sufficiently helpful.

WOW I loved this place! Went with a friend after work on a weekday with a reservation and the food was phenomenal. The quality of food on each dish was nothing less than outstanding, and you can tell each plate was thoughtfully composed. I described the atmosphere as â€œapproachable chicâ€ â€” very low key but with personality. Staff was extremely friendly and plates came out swiftly. Already planning my next after work dinner plans here!

This place is an absolute gem! The food is delicious and the restaurant is awesome, all at affordable prices. Weâ€™ve visited this place four times in just two months because we believe itâ€™s hard to beat the value proposition it offers. Itâ€™s a must-visit!
Good quality food. Small portions but priced right. Didnâ€™t give a four star but could have. Small water glasses and servers not that interested in filling them.

While I only tried a few dishes, I found them all to be rather bland. I really couldn't taste much of a difference between duck, octopus, or anchovies, and pork ramen was also bland. I had a standard martini, but it was rather watery. Perhaps other dishes are better. The bar seating facing the kitchen is rather cramped with not much space. I had high hopes but I will not be returning.

Almost all the dishes were amazing! I especially enjoyed the sashimi salad and the different skewers (which I forgot to take pictures of). The sesame pudding as a dessert was lovely.

Unagi don was good but at par with most other japanese restaurants. The chocolate cake was a bit too sweet.

Lovely experience! Host was attentive and kind. Our waiters were great. The food came fast and the dishes were delicious and very filling. We came during lunch (12-2:30PM) for their lunch special and it was worth the price. The atmosphere was aesthetically pleasing. I will definitely be coming back for dinner!
Great izakaya spot, they have nice seafood yakitori options. There are also several vegetarian dishes.
